thread.title: 5 Mets the Los Angeles Dodgers fear in the NLDS
thread.title_full: 5 Mets the Los Angeles Dodgers fear in the NLDS | NJ.com

author: Mike Vorkunov | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: 5 Mets the Los Angeles Dodgers fear in the NLDS
text:
NEW YORK — In a short series, a best-of-five, anything can happen. One hot streak. One bad spell. And it's over quickly.
So there's a lot to fear for teams. A lot to believe can go wrong.
And when the Dodgers play the Mets in the National League Division Series , they will have a few players to fear. The Mets have talent in many places. It makes for a fearsome bunch to face over a week.
METS 2015 NLDS PREVIEW : How Mets overcame headaches and torn UCLs to keep their pitching in line for the NLDS We've identified the five players the Dodgers should fear most this week. If we missed one, let us know. Sure, L.A. has Clayton Kershaw and Zack Greinke, but the Mets have some guys to watch too.
"I know who we're facing but – I don't want to say anything – they're facing some couple pretty good guys too," Mets manager Terry Collins said.
Meanwhile, we know Yoenis Cespedes fears no one and nothing. Not Kershaw. Not Greinke. Not the Dodgers. Not death.
"I am 100 percent ready to start this battle," he said through an interpreter this week.
He added: "They're pitchers just like anyone else. They're going to throw the same pitches. I think the most important thing is to have fun."
This is going to be fun. The best playoff series of the first round. Just look at all that talent.
